abstracts.cdata!:
The project would promote economy and
            efficiency in UTE's operations and administration in
            accordance with the power sector strategy.  It specifically
            consists of:  (1) a feasibility study for the rehabilitation
            of the Gabriel Terra hydroplant; (2) a distribution system
            study; (3) an operation planning study; and (4) a training
            program for managerial level officers.  It further includes;
            (5) installation of meters to implement a power tariff
            structure based on marginal cost criteria; and (6) purchase
            of instruments and materials for distribution system
            maintenance and monitoring the safety of the Gabriel Terra
            Dam.  The proposed loan would assist UTE to reduce system
            losses, improve operating efficiency and management
            practices, develop an adequate planning framework for the
            distribution network, and rationalize electricity use by consumers.
